titleStmt.title: Some account of the tryals and condemnation of five notorious Jesuits, popish priests, & traytors (viz.) Thomas White, alias Whitebread, William Harcourt, John Fenwick, John Gavern, alias Gawen, Anthony Turner, and Mr. Langhorn the councellor, found guilty of high treason for conspiring to murder the King, subvert the government, root out of the Protestant religion, and establish popery &c. : on a fair tryal by virtue of a commission of Oyer and Terminer at the Old-Baily, June the 13th and 14th, 1679.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
